original: @244a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @244a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ku ru kulle s'a dha nam /
analyzed: ku ru kulle s'a dha nam /
translated: Kurukulle-sadhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: ku ru kulle'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
analyzed: ku ru kulle'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
translated: Kurukulle's Means of Achievement

original: aom bcom ldan 'das 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: aom bcom ldan 'das 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Om. Homage to the Blessed Noble Goddess Tara.

original: re zhig dang po kho nar sems dpa'i skyil krung bcas la /
analyzed: re zhig dang po kho nar sems dpa'i skyil krung bcas la /
translated: First of all, one should sit in the sattva posture,

original: bgegs bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: bgegs bsal bar bya'o //
translated: and dispel obstacles.

original: sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom aa mri ti h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa mri ti h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Om amriti hum phat svāhā.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i dkyil du dmigs la /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i dkyil du dmigs la /
translated: Then, one should visualize the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas in the center of space,

original: de ma thag tu skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ma thag tu skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste /
translated: and immediately go for refuge:

original: aom ratna tra yam sma sha ra nam kri tva /
analyzed: aom ratna tra yam sma sha ra nam kri tva /
translated: Om ratna-trayāya śaraṇaṃ gacchāmi.

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a wa shudho& ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a wa shudho& ham /
translated: Om svabhāva-śuddhāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ svabhāva-śuddho 'ham.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /🔽de nas yi ge pam las padma /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham / de nas yi ge pam las padma /
translated: Om śūnyatā-jñāna-vajrasvabhāvātmako 'ham.🔽Then, from the syllable pam, a lotus,

original: de'i steng du yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: on top of that, from the syllable a, a moon-disk,

original: de la yi ge t'am de yongs su gyur pa las autpala /
analyzed: de la yi ge t'am de yongs su gyur pa las autpala /
translated: The syllable ta or that completely transforms into a blue lotus.

original: de'i rjes la spyan drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la spyan drang bar bya ste /
translated: After that, one should invite [the goddess]:

original: aom bha ga wa ti sa ma ya shva re sarbo tta ma ti ta dza: aa dhi shtha nam mi ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom bha ga wa ti sa ma ya shva re sarbo tta ma ti ta dza: aa dhi shtha nam mi ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ Bhagavatī Samaya Śrī Sarva-Oṃ Tathāgata Mati Tajaḥ Adhiṣṭhānaṃ Kuru Sva Hā

original: de las bcom ldan 'das ma zhal gsum pa phyag drug ma /
analyzed: de las bcom ldan 'das ma zhal gsum pa phyag drug ma /
translated: From that, the Blessed Lady has three faces and six arms.

original: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa yang rtsa ba'i zhal ni gnag pa dang ser ba dang dmar ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa yang rtsa ba'i zhal ni gnag pa dang ser ba dang dmar ba'o //
translated: The right and left [faces] are black and yellow, and the principal face is red.

original: g-yas pa'i phyag rnams kyi dang po mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la 'khor lo dkar pos mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag rnams kyi dang po mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa la 'khor lo dkar pos mtshan pa'o //
translated: The first of the right hands gives refuge and is marked with a white wheel.

original: gnyis pa la mda'/
analyzed: gnyis pa la mda'/
translated: The second holds an arrow.

original: gsum pa la lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la lcags kyu'o //
translated: The third holds a goad.

original: phyag g-yon pa rnams kyi dang po la autpala dmar po rin po che'i snye ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa rnams kyi dang po la autpala dmar po rin po che'i snye ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The first of the left hands holds a red lotus with a jewel bud.

original: gnyis pa la gzhu /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gzhu /
translated: The second holds a bow.

original: gsum pa la zhags pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la zhags pa'o //
translated: The third holds a noose.

original: sku mdog dmar po padma dmar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sku mdog dmar po padma dmar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: Red in color, she sits on a red lotus seat.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan can /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan can /
translated: She has the crown of the five tathāgatas.

original: sku la rgyan thams cad kyis @244b brgyan pa /🔽shar gyi phyogs su gsal ba'i sgrol ma /🔽lho ru rdzogs byed sgrol ma /
analyzed: sku la rgyan thams cad kyis @244b brgyan pa / shar gyi phyogs su gsal ba'i sgrol ma / lho ru rdzogs byed sgrol ma /
translated: Her body is adorned with all the ornaments.🔽In the east is Shining Tara.🔽In the south is Accomplishing Tara.

original: nub tu snang byed sgrol ma /🔽byang du karna sgrol ma /
analyzed: nub tu snang byed sgrol ma / byang du karna sgrol ma /
translated: In the west is Illuminating Tara.🔽In the north is Karna Tara.

original: me'i mtshams su rin chen sgrol ma /
analyzed: me'i mtshams su rin chen sgrol ma /
translated: In the southeast is Jewel Tara.

original: bden bral gyi mtshams su rgyal ba sgrol ma /🔽rlung gi mtshams su dkar mo sgrol ma /
analyzed: bden bral gyi mtshams su rgyal ba sgrol ma / rlung gi mtshams su dkar mo sgrol ma /
translated: In the southwest is Victorious Tara.🔽In the northwest is White Tara.

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su dpa' bo'i sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su dpa' bo'i sgrol ma'o //
translated: In the northeast is Heroine Tara.

original: 'di rnams ni phyag bzhi pa mchog sbyin pa dang / autpala dang mda' dang gzhu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni phyag bzhi pa mchog sbyin pa dang / autpala dang mda' dang gzhu bsnams pa'o //
translated: All of them have four arms, and they hold a boon-granting hand, an utpala, a bow, and an arrow.

original: sku mdog dmar po padma dmar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sku mdog dmar po padma dmar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: Their bodies are red, and they sit on red lotus seats.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan can /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan can /
translated: They have crowns with the five Tathagatas.

original: sku la rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: sku la rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: Their bodies are adorned with all the ornaments.

original: de rnams kyi sngags ni /🔽aom ku ru kulle h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sngags ni / aom ku ru kulle h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
translated: Their mantras are:🔽Om kuru kulle hum hrim svha.

original: aom pra sanna t'a ri h'um hr'iim sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom pra sanna t'a ri h'um hr'iim sv'a h'a /
translated: Om prasannadharini hum hrim svha.

original: aom ne sanna t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ne sanna t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ ne san tāri hūṃ hriṃ svāhā.

original: aom d'i pa t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /🔽aom karna t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom d'i pa t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a / aom karna t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ dīpa tāri hūṃ hriṃ svāhā.🔽Oṃ karṇa tāri hūṃ hriṃ svāhā.

original: aom ma ni t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /🔽aom dza ya t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ma ni t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a / aom dza ya t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ maṇi tāri hūṃ hriṃ svāhā.🔽Oṃ jaya tāri hūṃ hriṃ svāhā.

original: aom goo r'i t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom goo r'i t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ gaurī tāri hūṃ hriṃ svāhā.

original: aom w'i ra t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom w'i ra t'a ri h'um hr'im sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vīra tāri hūṃ hriṃ svāhā.

original: shar phyogs kyi sgor ni rdo rje ro langs ma //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sgor ni rdo rje ro langs ma //
translated: At the eastern gate is Vajra Vetālī,

original: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
analyzed: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
translated: baring her fangs,

original: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
translated: her face contorted,

original: 'jigs su rung pa'i cha byad can //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung pa'i cha byad can //
translated: with a terrifying appearance.

original: phyag bzhi pa la /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa la /
translated: She has four arms,

original: mda' dang gzhu dang rdo rje lcags kyu dang zhags pa pi wang bsnams pa /
analyzed: mda' dang gzhu dang rdo rje lcags kyu dang zhags pa pi wang bsnams pa /
translated: holding a bow and arrow, a vajra hook, a lasso, and a vīṇā.

original: mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can /
translated: She has Akṣobhya as her head ornament.

original: lho'i sgor ni rdo rje dri 'dzin ma //🔽zhal rnam par gtsigs pa /🔽dbu skra 'khyil ba /
analyzed: lho'i sgor ni rdo rje dri 'dzin ma // zhal rnam par gtsigs pa / dbu skra 'khyil ba /
translated: At the southern gate is Vajra Gandhāri,🔽baring her fangs,🔽her hair coiled,

original: gsus pa 'phyang ba /
analyzed: gsus pa 'phyang ba /
translated: her belly hanging down.

original: phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa /
translated: She has four arms,

original: rdo rje dang dril bu dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: He holds a vajra, a bell, a goad, and a noose.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi cod pan can no //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi cod pan can no //
translated: He has a crown with Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: nub kyi sgo ru gzhan gyis mi thub pa /🔽dbu skra gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: nub kyi sgo ru gzhan gyis mi thub pa / dbu skra gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: At the western gate is Aparājitā.🔽Her hair is bristling upward.

original: gsus pa 'phyang ba /
analyzed: gsus pa 'phyang ba /
translated: Her belly hangs down.

original: phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa /
translated: She has four arms.

original: sdigs mdzub dang / lcags kyu dang / zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: sdigs mdzub dang / lcags kyu dang / zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: She holds a threatening mudrā, a goad, and a noose.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dbu rgyan can /
translated: She has a crown with Amitābha.

original: byang gi sgor ni ral pa gcig ma /🔽dbu skra gyen du brdzis pa /
analyzed: byang gi sgor ni ral pa gcig ma / dbu skra gyen du brdzis pa /
translated: At the northern gate is Ekavīrā.🔽Her hair is bristling upward.

original: gsus pa 'phyang ba /
analyzed: gsus pa 'phyang ba /
translated: Her belly hangs down.

original: phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa /
translated: She has four arms.

original: tho ba dang / rdo rje dang / dgra sta dang / zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: tho ba dang / rdo rje dang / dgra sta dang / zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: She holds a hammer, a vajra, a battle-ax, and a noose.

original: don yod grub pa'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: She has a crown with Amoghasiddhi.

original: g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum gyis gnas pas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum gyis gnas pas bzhugs pa /
translated: She stands with her right leg straight and her left knee on the ground.

original: sgo ma bzhi po rnams sku mdog dmar ba padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sgo ma bzhi po rnams sku mdog dmar ba padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The four gate goddesses are red in color and stand on lotus seats.

original: 'di rnams kyi sngags ni /🔽aom badzra wa ti li h'um phat /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sngags ni / aom badzra wa ti li h'um phat /
translated: Their mantras are:🔽Oṃ vajra-Vāṭīli hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra ghandha ri h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra ghandha ri h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-Gandharī hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra aa pa r'i dzi ta h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra aa pa r'i dzi ta h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra Aparājita hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra ae ka dza t'a h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra ae ka dza t'a h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra Ekajaṭī hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya bo dhi sa tv'a @245a * //
analyzed: aom a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya bo dhi sa tv'a @245a * //
translated: Oṃ to the noble Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva🔽who has great compassion,

original: ya / ma h'a sa tv'a ya /
analyzed: ya / ma h'a sa tv'a ya /
translated: the great being,

original: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
translated: the great compassionate one.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā:

original: aom a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha /
analyzed: aom a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha /
translated: Oṃ āgaccha āgaccha.

original: bha ga wa ti t'a ri a'arya ba li ki te shva ra sa tye na sv'a h'a /
analyzed: bha ga wa ti t'a ri a'arya ba li ki te shva ra sa tye na sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ bhagavatī tāre āryāvalokiteśvara satyena svāhā.

original: gu gul gyi spos la lan bdun yongs su bzlas nas spyan drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gu gul gyi spos la lan bdun yongs su bzlas nas spyan drang bar bya'o //
translated: Having recited the mantra seven times over agalloch incense, one should invite [the deity].

original: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā:

original: aom so ri so ra ba te he ra he ra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom so ri so ra ba te he ra he ra sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ sorisoribati herahera svāhā.

original: aargha'i sngags so //
analyzed: aargha'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for argha.

original: na ma: a'a ry'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma: a'a ry'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā:

original: aom ta ri ta ri ba ti sarba tsa turtha s'a dha ne ta shtha tishtha /
analyzed: aom ta ri ta ri ba ti sarba tsa turtha s'a dha ne ta shtha tishtha /
translated: Oṃ taritarivati sarva caturtha sādhane tasthatiṣṭha.

original: yad kary'am siddhi me ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: yad kary'am siddhi me ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Yadakarma siddhi me kuru svāhā.

original: me tog gi sngags so //
analyzed: me tog gi sngags so //
translated: The mantra for flowers.

original: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: NAMAḤ ARHATE Avalokiteśvara.🔽Tadyathā:

original: tadya th'a / me gha me gha sv'a ri do ga sv'a ku ru ku ru bha ra bha ra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: tadya th'a / me gha me gha sv'a ri do ga sv'a ku ru ku ru bha ra bha ra sv'a h'a /
translated: MEGHA MEGHA SVĀRĪ DOGA SVĀKURU KURUBHARABHARA SVĀHĀ.

original: bdug spos kyi sngags so //
analyzed: bdug spos kyi sngags so //
translated: The mantra of incense.

original: na ma: a'ary'a pa li ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma: a'ary'a pa li ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: NAMAḤ ARHATE Avalokiteśvara.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā:

original: aom bokka bokka bha ma ne dzv'a la dz'a la d'i pa sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom bokka bokka bha ma ne dzv'a la dz'a la d'i pa sv'a h'a /
translated: OṂ BOKKA BOKKA BHAMANI JVALA JVALA DIPA SVĀHĀ.

original: mar me'i sngags so //
analyzed: mar me'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of lamps.

original: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: NAMAḤ ARHATE Avalokiteśvara.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā:

original: aom ha ra ha ra ho ru ho ru gandha ba sa ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ha ra ha ra ho ru ho ru gandha ba sa ni sv'a h'a /
translated: OṂ HARA HARA HORU HORU GANDHAVA SANI SVĀHĀ.

original: dri'i sngags so //
analyzed: dri'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of scent.

original: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: NAMAḤ ARHATE Avalokiteśvara.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā:

original: aom sva bh'a ba di ha di ha ku ru ku ru de sham ba lim h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba di ha di ha ku ru ku ru de sham ba lim h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: OṂ SVABHĀVA DHIH DHIH KURU KURUDEŚAM BALIM HŪM PHAṬ SVĀHĀ.

original: gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of the bali offering.

original: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma: a'ary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: NAMAḤ ARHATE Avalokiteśvara.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā:

original: he re he re ha ra ha ra sarba sa tva k'a ru ni sh'i ghram a'a gatstsha de ba t'a bha ga w'an a'ary'a ba lo ke te shva ra sa ma ya ma nu sma ra na sv'a h'a /
analyzed: he re he re ha ra ha ra sarba sa tva k'a ru ni sh'i ghram a'a gatstsha de ba t'a bha ga w'an a'ary'a ba lo ke te shva ra sa ma ya ma nu sma ra na sv'a h'a /
translated: Heri heri hara hara sarva-sattvâkârunîśa ghrâma āgaccha devatâbhagavati âryâvalokiteśvara samânamasmaraṇa svâhâ.

original: me tog gi thal mo sbyar la gtor mar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog gi thal mo sbyar la gtor mar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should offer the oblation with the añjali gesture of flowers.

original: gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: gshegs su gsol ba'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for requesting departure is:

original: aom pra sanna ne span pra ti pra ka ra na ma ne dza ya gu re sa wi re ta ra we ta le gandha re sa badzra ha sta /
analyzed: aom pra sanna ne span pra ti pra ka ra na ma ne dza ya gu re sa wi re ta ra we ta le gandha re sa badzra ha sta /
translated: Om prasannene sphatiprakaranamamane jayagure svire tavate tale gandhare savâjrahaste |

original: aa pa r'a dzi ta ae ka dz'a tam na ma mi: aom ta ra ta ra ne h'um ha ra ha ra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aa pa r'a dzi ta ae ka dz'a tam na ma mi: aom ta ra ta ra ne h'um ha ra ha ra sv'a h'a /
translated: Aparâjitâ ekajâtam namami | Om taratarane hum harahara svâhâ.

original: khyu mchog gi rva'i 'jim pa la lag pa g-yon pa nyid kyis lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas nas btab na dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi rva'i 'jim pa la lag pa g-yon pa nyid kyis lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas nas btab na dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should anoint the clay of the bull's horn with one's left hand, repeating it twenty-one times. If one anoints, one will be brought under control.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ku ru kulle'i sgrub pa'i rdzogs so /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ku ru kulle'i sgrub pa'i rdzogs so /
translated: The practice of the Blessed Lady Kurukullâ is complete.

original: // / pandi ta bim pa dang / lo ts'a ba gzhon nu 'od kyis bsgyur ba//
analyzed: // / pandi ta bim pa dang / lo ts'a ba gzhon nu 'od kyis bsgyur ba//
translated: The pandit Vimala and the translator Shonu translated this.
